commit_message:
WIP: Tool to list launchpad bug status

Change-Id: I89b7b778e4b357545ea4058691fe552735fd3c8c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/23/774223/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/usr/bin/env python3 # Copyright 2021 Ericsson Software Technology # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. # This script lists launchpad bug status. Example usage: # # $ ./list_bug_status.py -b stein 1893263 1892961 1841363 1879787 1489304 # # To get a list of bug number in a <CURRENT_RELEASE>, e.g. run: # # $ git log --no-merges <PREVIOUS_RELEASE>..<CURRENT_RELEASE> | \ # awk 'tolower($0) ~ /closes-bug/ { gsub("#",""); print $2 }' ORS=' ' from os.path import expanduser import sys import argparse from launchpadlib import launchpad HOME = expanduser('~') CACHEDIR = f'{HOME}/.launchpadlib/cache/' PROJECT = 'nova' VALID_BRANCH_NAMES = ['ocata', 'queens', 'rocky', 'stein', 'train', 'ussuri', 'victoria', 'wallaby'] def show_bug_info_on_target(target, bugs): lp = launchpad.Launchpad.login_anonymously(PROJECT, 'production', CACHEDIR, version='devel') for bug in bugs: bug_info = lp.bugs[bug] bug_tasks = bug_info.bug_tasks target_found = False for task in bug_tasks: if task.bug_target_name == target: result = f'#{bug} {task.bug_target_name} -- {task.status}' if task.status != 'Fix Released': result += f' -- {task.web_link}' print(result) target_found = True if not target_found: print(f'#{bug} does not have target: {target} -- to create, ' f'visit: {task.web_link}') def validate_branch(branch): if branch not in VALID_BRANCH_NAMES: print(f'{branch} does not seam a valid branch name.') print(f'It should be for example {VALID_BRANCH_NAMES[1]} or ' f'{VALID_BRANCH_NAMES[2]}, etc...') sys.exit(1) return f'{PROJECT}/{branch}' def main(): parser = argparse.ArgumentParser() parser.add_argument('-b', '--branch', required=True, help='stable/{branch} to view') parser.add_argument('bug_numbers', metavar='bug', type=int, nargs='+', help='bug number(s)') args = parser.parse_args() bug_target_name = validate_branch(args.branch) bugs = args.bug_numbers show_bug_info_on_target(bug_target_name, bugs) if __name__ == '__main__': main()

Make release of tripleo-ipsec master/victoria/ussuri - fix bad tags

As described in the related bug we need to tag a new version for
master victoria and ussuri to fix multiple tags pointing to the same
commit.

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I1bf49912816829a47e6250d9f9d8a6ce88cb68ad

commit_message:
Hack out pbr versioninfo to test entrypoints cost

PBR will pull in pkg_resources to determine the package version at
runtime. This incurs the cost of doing package listing and sorting that
we are trying to avoid when using entrypoints. This change shouldn't be
merged but gives us somethign to compare against.

Change-Id: Icc81e122b414d43cac31249dc85c892dd1fa0300
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient refs/changes/85/566685/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class VersionInfoHack(object): def __init__(self, name): self.name = name def version_string(self): return '3.16.0' def release_string(self): return '3.16.0' version_info = VersionInfoHack('python-openstackclient')

commit_message:
Use entrypoints lib instead of pkg_resources

Some quick local trivial testing shows that this lib is significantly
quicker at listing entrypoints than pkg_resources is. This change will
test how this does in a more "real" world situation.

Change-Id: I933ccd613c1002bceb89255d5db90523b814a50f

commit_message:
add optional argument metric to set metric for routes

A routing metric is a quantitative value used to evaluate
the path cost. A new optional argument metric can be added
to set the metric for the routes. This value can be set by
the user or have a default value.

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1759790
Implements: [RFE] metric for the route

Change-Id: Idd9bfd740a91003bb362e35d988576c8c52803ee

commit_message:
Corrected 'openstack subnet show’ output for field allocation pool.

change 'openstack subnet show’ output same as 'neutron subnet-show’  as existing
output is complex if more than one allocation pool allocated to 1 subnet.

Change-Id: Ia69b72e57a7328612846115f11b862aa8517abcb
Closes-Bug:  #1651733

commit_message:
Update endpoint-delete, endpoint-show, endpoint-set method

When we delete an endpoint which is not exists, the results should
be 'not found'. But now, the openstackclient of the endpoint-delete
just return 'More than one endpoint with the name XXX'. For the Endpoint
class with name query like /endpoints?name=XXX, the result ignores
the query which is not the same as others like Project. So, I think
we should not use find_source() method. We may get from the client
directly.

Also, when we show and set an endpint which is not extis like endpoint-delete.
We should get from the client and catch or raise the exception.

Closes-Bug: #1683231
Change-Id: I94da0a7fe0f6e2fdf9af4171c20bac266ad51af3

commit_message:
Add a nodejs10-publish-to-npm project template

Like the nodejs{4,6,8}-publish-to-npm templates, 10 seems to be the
first version which can run on ubuntu-focal nodes so add it as an
option.

commit_message:
Add "--sort" option to "volume backup list" in a common way

Add a commom method "add_sort_option_to_parser()"
to support adding "--sort" option for list commands.
this review use it for "volume backup list" command first.

Change-Id: I9bbe6922f5b5476be186dfa30fb79c548ecc5df9
Implements: bp add-sort-option

added_lines: import copy class ImageListProject(command.Lister): """List sharing permissions of project with image""" def get_parser(self, prog_name): parser = super(ImageListProject, self).get_parser(prog_name) parser.add_argument( "image_id", metavar="<image_id>", help=_("Image ID to list"), ) return parser def take_action(self, parsed_args): image_client = self.app.client_manager.image columns = [ 'Image ID', 'Member ID', 'Status', ] column_headers = copy.deepcopy(columns) column_headers[1] = 'Project' image_id = utils.find_resource( image_client.images, parsed_args.image_id).id data = image_client.image_members.list(image_id) return (column_headers, (utils.get_item_properties(s, columns, formatters={}, ) for s in data))

commit_message:
Add support for setting and removing tags from server instance

Enable adding and removing server tags with `server set` and `server
unset` commands (--os-compute-api-version >= 2.26).
This is done using SDK connection. As a followup complete SetServer and
UnsetServer can be switched to SDK.

Change-Id: I06d726273c62bce790cd1ae1119dbae98c9e1f74
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient refs/changes/74/697674/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: parser.add_argument( '--tag', metavar='<tag>', action='append', help=_('New Tag (supported by --os-compute-api-version 2.26 and ' 'above') ) if parsed_args.tag: if server.api_version < api_versions.APIVersion("2.26"): msg = _("Modifying tags is not supported for " "--os-compute-api-version less than 2.26") raise exceptions.CommandError(msg) sdk = self.app.client_manager.sdk_connection.compute server = sdk.get_server(server.id) for tag in parsed_args.tag: server.add_tag(sdk, tag) parser.add_argument( '--tag', metavar='<tag>', action='append', help=_('Unset tag (supported by --os-compute-api-version 2.26 and ' 'above') ) if parsed_args.tag: if compute_client.api_version < api_versions.APIVersion("2.26"): msg = _("Modifying tags is not supported for " "--os-compute-api-version less than 2.26") raise exceptions.CommandError(msg) sdk = self.app.client_manager.sdk_connection.compute server = sdk.get_server(server.id) for tag in parsed_args.tag: server.remove_tag(sdk, tag)

commit_message:
Query args for get-only

The docstring for find_resource says that kwargs are passed to
.find(), but these were also being passed to .get(). .get()
is called using the resource by ID so it doesn't always make
sense to pass query args to it. Callers need to be able to
pass query params that don't get passed to get().

Change-Id: Ibf33aa155263d7eeaf4981259dfeed6cdee1e90a
Closes-Bug: #1546663
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient refs/changes/48/202748/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def find_resource(manager, name_or_id, get_kwargs=None, **kwargs): :param get_kwargs: to be used in calling .get() :param kwargs: To be used in calling .find() and .get() get_kwargs = get_kwargs or {} return manager.get(int(name_or_id), **get_kwargs) return manager.get(name_or_id, **get_kwargs) kwargs.update(get_kwargs)
deleted_lines: def find_resource(manager, name_or_id, **kwargs): :param kwargs: To be used in calling .find() return manager.get(int(name_or_id), **kwargs) return manager.get(name_or_id, **kwargs)

commit_message:
json-rpc: surround IPv6 address with [] in conductor URL

If the conductor's host option is configured to be an IPv6 address, we
need to surround it with [] when incorporating it in a URL to contact
the conductor over json-rpc.

Change-Id: Ib3bc4c570ec0f2e5c73e3ce15b05684b8e4c1ff9
Story: 2008288
Task: 41166
(cherry picked from commit 85b489288669af342bbbd4b0a875580a346c2441)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/06/762106/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_call_ipv4_success(self, mock_session): response = mock_session.return_value.post.return_value response.json.return_value = { 'jsonrpc': '2.0', 'result': 42 } cctx = self.client.prepare('foo.192.0.2.1') self.assertEqual('192.0.2.1', cctx.host) result = cctx.call(self.context, 'do_something', answer=42) self.assertEqual(42, result) mock_session.return_value.post.assert_called_once_with( 'http://192.0.2.1:8089', json={'jsonrpc': '2.0', 'method': 'do_something', 'params': {'answer': 42, 'context': self.ctx_json}, 'id': self.context.request_id}) def test_call_ipv6_success(self, mock_session): response = mock_session.return_value.post.return_value response.json.return_value = { 'jsonrpc': '2.0', 'result': 42 } cctx = self.client.prepare('foo.2001:db8::1') self.assertEqual('2001:db8::1', cctx.host) result = cctx.call(self.context, 'do_something', answer=42) self.assertEqual(42, result) mock_session.return_value.post.assert_called_once_with( 'http://[2001:db8::1]:8089', json={'jsonrpc': '2.0', 'method': 'do_something', 'params': {'answer': 42, 'context': self.ctx_json}, 'id': self.context.request_id})

Functional test for volume transfer request

Refactor functional tests for testing more command options.

Change-Id: I33d44b9422e4dcc85617962029583444d9781cfa

import json import timefrom openstackclient.tests.functional.volume.v1 import common VOLUME_NAME_1 = uuid.uuid4().hex VOLUME_NAME_2 = uuid.uuid4().hex @classmethod def wait_for_status(cls, command, status, tries): opts = cls.get_opts(['status']) for attempt in range(tries): time.sleep(1) raw_output = cls.openstack(command + opts) if (raw_output == status): return cls.assertOutput(status, raw_output) cmd_output = json.loads(cls.openstack( 'volume create -f json ' + '--size 1 ' + cls.VOLUME_NAME_1 )) cls.wait_for_status('volume show ' + cls.VOLUME_NAME_1, 'available
', 6) cls.VOLUME_ID_1 = cmd_output['id'] cmd_output = json.loads(cls.openstack( 'volume create -f json ' + '--size 1 ' + cls.VOLUME_NAME_2 )) cls.wait_for_status('volume show ' + cls.VOLUME_NAME_2, 'available
', 6) cls.VOLUME_ID_2 = cmd_output['id'] cls.wait_for_status('volume show ' + cls.VOLUME_NAME_1, 'available

request create -f json ' + self.VOLUME_NAME_1 + ' --name ' + name )) auth_key = cmd_output['auth_key'] transfer_id = cmd_output['id'] self.assertEqual( self.VOLUME_ID_1, cmd_output['volume_id'], ) self.assertEqual( name, cmd_output['name'], ) cmd_output = json.loads(self.openstack( 'volume transfer request accept -f json ' + name + ' ' + auth_key)) self.assertEqual( self.VOLUME_ID_1, multiple""" name1 = uuid.uuid4().hex name2 = uuid.uuid4().hex cmd_output = json.loads(self.openstack( 'volume transfer request create -f json ' + self.VOLUME_NAME_1 + ' --name ' + name1 )) self.VOLUME_NAME_2 + ' --name ' + name2 )) self.addCleanup(self.openstack, 'volume transfer request delete ' + name2) transfer_id_2 = cmd_output['id'] self.assertEqual( self.VOLUME_ID_2, cmd_output['volume_id'], ) self.assertEqual( name2, cmd_output['name'], ) cmd_output = json.loads(self.openstack( 'volume transfer request list -f json')) transfer_names = [x["Name"] for x in self.assertIn(transfer_id_1, transfer_ids) self.assertIn(transfer_id_2, transfer_ids) self.assertIn(self.VOLUME_ID_1, volume_ids) self.assertIn(self.VOLUME_ID_2, volume_ids) name = uuid.uuid4().hex cmd_output = json.loads(self.openstack( 'volume transfer request create -f json ' + self.VOLUME_NAME_1 + ' --name ' + name )) self.addCleanup(self.openstack, 'volume transfer request delete ' + name) commit_message:
Proposing ironic-prometheus-exporter for wallaby

Proposing release for cycle-with-intermediary deliverables that have not released yet.

If you wants to wait for a specific patch to make it to the release, someone from your team can -1 the patch to have it held, or update that patch with a different commit SHA.

Patches with no response will be merged by Friday March 26.

$ git log --oneline --no-merges 2.1.1..1ec7859
1ec7859 Add bifrost job and update docs
198f07d Reconfigure tox.ini
36f2ccb Remove lower-constraints job
c5d4ea9 Set safe version of hacking
e33f2e7 Add Python3 wallaby unit tests
0f9da06 Migrate IPE job to focal
8d25757 Update master for stable/victoria

Signed-off-by: Armstrong Foundjem <foundjem@ieee.org>
Change-Id: Ib12dbbb007c93497776623a4c4b6d79249376a2a

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I5300d1576fb87881ead185ae71aafea36f4cb74b

commit_message:
Check for existence instead of fetching the whole net object

There is no need to fetch the whole net object
(which leads to several heavy DB requests according
to OSProfiler stats) when only need to check net existence

This speeds up port creation up to 15%

Closes-Bug: #1917866
Change-Id: I75db7c713a17a0f1b1b5aecc6eec93e636a71827

Update master for stable/wallaby

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/wallaby.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/wallaby.

Sem-Ver: feature
Change-Id: Ic7a99450f00af14f0b38dbc39f7bddebac25a8d7

subject: libvirt: Use specific user when probing encrypted rbd disks during extend
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-02-01 16:00:41.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/5d1adb2604de37ad6717a604b87d9fbaf35f0999', 'message': "libvirt: Use specific user when probing encrypted rbd disks during extend

I0c3f14100a18107f7e416293f3d4fcc641ce5e55 introduced new logic when
extending LUKSv1 encrypted rbd volumes. As part of this qemu-img is used
to probe the rbd volume to determine the size of the LUKSv1 header.

The URI used to point to the rbd volume did not provide a user and
assumed that n-cpu/privsep would have access to the admin keyring. This
isn't always the case in most environments and would result in a failure
to probe the disk when the admin keyring wasn't available.

This change resolves this by appending the `id:$username` option to the
end of the URI provided to qemu-img using the `auth_username` found in
the connection_info from Cinder.

Closes-Bug: #1913575
Change-Id: Ia6d6dcdd7042f2aef6b3abeb5cd0f7525678a3b7
(cherry picked from commit b62a1abd616cea7fdfcad18e1cf548767d67b6dd)
"}]
commit_message:
libvirt: Use specific user when probing encrypted rbd disks during extend

I0c3f14100a18107f7e416293f3d4fcc641ce5e55 introduced new logic when
extending LUKSv1 encrypted rbd volumes. As part of this qemu-img is used
to probe the rbd volume to determine the size of the LUKSv1 header.

The URI used to point to the rbd volume did not provide a user and
assumed that n-cpu/privsep would have access to the admin keyring. This
isn't always the case in most environments and would result in a failure
to probe the disk when the admin keyring wasn't available.

This change resolves this by appending the `id:$username` option to the
end of the URI provided to qemu-img using the `auth_username` found in
the connection_info from Cinder.

Closes-Bug: #1913575

commit_message:
[murano] Create for all client and non-client lib wallaby branch

This creates the stable/wallaby branch for all client and non-client
libraries
now that we are past the lib freeze on March 11.

If a team wants to wait for a specific patch to make it to the library,
someone from the team can -1 the patch to have it held,or update that
patch with a different commit SHA.

Patches with no response will be merged by Friday, March 19.

Change-Id: I503f88648ad819270ce8481ba755d66c0ec1eb98

commit_message:
[mistral] Create for all client and non-client lib wallaby branch

This creates the stable/wallaby branch for all client and non-client libraries
now that we are past the lib freeze on March 11.

If a team wants to wait for a specific patch to make it to the library,
someone from the team can -1 the patch to have it held,or update that
patch with a different commit SHA.

Patches with no response will be merged by Friday, March 19.

Change-Id: Ibff60e6a94654e76befd9fa4fdaebe39389c0903

commit_message:
Fix miss formatting array to print in ShowServer

Currently, When the formatter is not table and result
of content contains list, the items of list were printed as a
concatenate with comma.

In this patch, if the output format is not table, the output
of list will follow the output format.
(e.g. json output = [ ])
This will put right output format for not only table
but also both json and yaml.

Change-Id: Ibf88593b1935c7ff42a5512136e0eca9f8466343
Story: 2007755

commit_message:
Proposing ironic-ui for wallaby

Proposing release for cycle-with-intermediary deliverables that have not released yet.

If you wants to wait for a specific patch to make it to the release, someone from your team can -1 the patch to have it held, or update that patch with a different commit SHA.

Patches with no response will be merged by Friday March 26.

$ git log --oneline --no-merges 4.2.0..63fa1fe
63fa1fe Add a release note for Wallaby
b12bbeb Imported Translations from Zanata
9887b96 Use permissions attribute to detect ironic service
12eca8a Fix unittest coverage bug
a3d0f4e Remove Chrome browser from karma.conf.js
9af5607 Remove hard-coded Python path in karma.conf.js
81aa74a Set safe version of hacking
a206b98 Imported Translations from Zanata
101f8ec Add Python3 wallaby unit tests
a455ca4 Update master for stable/victoria
0d997bf Add npm tox env

Signed-off-by: Armstrong Foundjem <foundjem@ieee.org>
Change-Id: I0dd941b56e858a66b80221c575affdbc67e70088

commit_message:
Proposing ovn-octavia-provider for wallaby

Proposing release for cycle-with-intermediary deliverables that have not released yet.

If you wants to wait for a specific patch to make it to the release, someone from your team can -1 the patch to have it held, or update that patch with a different commit SHA.

Patches with no response will be merged by Friday March 26.

$ git log --oneline --no-merges 0.3.0..915e561
516e5c3 Start running the tempest API tests
7bd6936 Switch to new rolevar for run-temepst role
b796f4e Add SCTP support
bdb7ca6 Remove devstack-gate reference
c7969b6 Update sample local.conf to mention OVN_BRANCH
6e30b85 Check if no members in pool better in batch update
a641c2c Don't try to store protocol=None in OVSDB
ffc3160 Update to pylint 2.6.0+
13331aa Collect OVN logs
15b3ca3 Enable the IPv6 tempest tests
2399b69 Correctly set member operating status
ba4c94e Change to build OVN from source
2225062 Delay string interpolations at logging calls
23f0bed Remove work around change for test_port_forwarding
b882a7f Fix gate failure
a238faf Return UnsupportedOptionError() on loadbalancer failover
037d3d0 Use get_ovn_ovsdb_retry_max_interval()
723ca5a Retry status updates to Octavia
5b0715d Fix leaked file descriptors by cleaning up objects
aa4ffe5 Change devstack script to correctly configure driver
350a26b Include python36-devel in bindep
7a8e45b Add master and release tempest jobs
b68d2a7 Fix and enable test_port_forwarding
884d5e1 Switch from unittest2 compat methods to Python 3.x methods
a278e59 Add Python3 wallaby unit tests
76b2088 Fix the check for allowed_cidrs in listeners
c2c87e6 Update master for stable/victoria
481f0b3 Mark test_port_forwarding unstable to fix gate
2476204 Set OPERATING_STATUS to ONLINE when pool created with listener

Signed-off-by: Armstrong Foundjem <foundjem@ieee.org>
Change-Id: I605db3a6b71093fb3f72444354ac7b2a83155c24

commit_message:
zuul: Introduce a multinode ceph job

This change introduces a multinode ceph job based on
tempest-multinode-full-py3 to be used to provide live migration and
other multinode coverage initially in the openstack/nova project.

As this job uses ceph for both Nova ephemeral
([libvirt]/imagebackend=rbd) and Cinder volume storage the live block
migration tests are skipped.

Change-Id: I9ffdff44a3ad42ebdf26ab72e24dfe3b12b1ef8b

This job enable the multiattach feature enable from stein on. # This job runs with multiattach enable from stable/stein on. branches: ^(?!stable/(ocata|pike|queens|rocky)).*$ vars: devstack_localrc: ENABLE_VOLUME_MULTIATTACH: true - devstack-multinode-plugin-ceph-tempest-py3: voting: false irrelevant-files: - ^.*\.rst$ - ^doc/.*$

commit_message:
Add new options to PKCS#11 backend

This patch adds support for a couple of new new options in the
PCKS#11 backends.  Namely 'token_labels' and 'os_locking_ok'.

Change-Id: Iba7013dd6e1b1e4650b25cd4dd8dc1f355ceb538
(cherry picked from commit 8685ed4a4cd3c886a00889bb150fbb3ba2620c8d)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-barbican refs/changes/95/780895/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - | Added support for a couple of new options for the PKCS#11 backend: ``[p11_crypto]\token_labels`` and ``[p11_crypto]\os_locking_ok``.

commit_message:
cinder backend: password should be secret

This change ensures that password information for cinder backend is
properly hidden.

Change-Id: Ib188ef46d53ea2ac2adc5deaf0d249f8bdb8f1aa
(cherry picked from commit 3a9ae92204091bfb4a16e7d342667a945df9a263)

This change converts our use of CentOS7/88 to UBI8, which should
provide a better test environment which will match that of
production for future releases of TripleO. While this image change
will better match production clouds thanks in large part to TCIB,
it will also remove our use of docker.io (dockerhub) which fraught
with peril due to the ongoing API rate limits saga.

commit_message:
Use the UBI8 image for testing

This change converts our use of CentOS7/88 to UBI8, which should
provide a better test environment which will match that of
production for future releases of TripleO. While this image change
will better match production clouds thanks in large part to TCIB,
it will also remove our use of docker.io (dockerhub) which fraught
with peril due to the ongoing API rate limits saga.

This change updates all uses of docker to podman and removes our docker
installation process from zuul and our local test process.

Change-Id: I69f3400568d865c1f3505913077ecd7fe36d7d43
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud (Strider) <gchamoul@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 5bf1427b43132259cd8e37d4b9c4479af9ece958)
(cherry picked from commit ca884424f4b6b25f8d46ecd192f7555007884f56)

commit_message:
Add "--remote" option to "volume snapshot delete"

Add "--remote" option to "volume snapshot delete" command
to support deleting the volume snapshot created by remote
source in volume v2.

Change-Id: I1472b0c58fffe3affdad1d8cc3bed9a85a27c601
Implements: bp cinder-command-support
Partial-Bug: #1618676

commit_message:
Make UpgradeInitCommand and UpgradeLeapp{ToRemove,ToInstall,CommandOptions} per-role

When specific roles are deployed with custom images, for example CephStorage with
overcloud-minimal, then the LeappCommandOptions and/or the list of packages to
be removed/installed is not the same across all roles.

This change makes four parameters to be customized on a per-role basis:
UpgradeInitCommand
UpgradeLeappToRemove
UpgradeLeappToInstall
UpgradeLeappCommandOptions

Related-Bug: 1915067
Closes-Bug: rhbz#1936419
Change-Id: Ifd373f7aba6d98baa843b141de8a2266eaa71a0b
(cherry picked from commit 155fe9454b907553a351e724da3b5ef3ce8dcb48)
(cherry picked from commit dbad3a079b7c04066008b6ef9cd38cdaa0b80056)

commit_message:
Optionally fail ceph-health if HEALTH_WARN

Helps controlling the behavior of the ceph-health check for it to
fail, optionally, not only when cluster is in _ERR state but also
in _WARN state.

Change-Id: I4eb7508c24cce0db3179d4f3ef26cabceb164716
Related-Bug: 1915700
(cherry picked from commit 67560d36c06860dc827ef8356f1023f42facdbec)
(cherry picked from commit 2896ce06d7aad365bc6f02d5ab60acbe45315eb5)

commit_message:
Add legacy fact setting

When we disable inject facts by default, there were some additional
roles that we missed (ipaclient).  We can just set the legacy facts to
prevent issues with missing distribution var updates.

Change-Id: Ib488a6573c035fc8288a4b24461af56d40416c5d
Related-Bug: #1919064
(cherry picked from commit d8408ebb86efdda0055ae41c6db350c14772dc6a)

commit_message:
network: Add '--project' to some list commands

Include '--project' and '--project-domain' filtering options to the
'security group rule list' and 'network rbac list' commands.

Change-Id: I19e423906846073cfa1e45b4a295b3a8f5d11970
Closes-Bug: #1648317

subject: Stop linting zuul-jobs from here
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-03-19 15:19:55.000000000', 'files': ['.ansible-lint'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/b6ff3078dc419bf5bdb91a92f9c9ba19dbec9c63', 'message': "Stop linting zuul-jobs from here

When we run ansible-lint on project-config the tool is finding and
reporting errors in zuul-jobs. Zuul-jobs appears to be included to
ensure that all the roles we use are defined, but we don't want to lint
the content of those roles.

To address this we add ../../zuul to the ansible lint exclude path which
includes zuul-jobs.

Change-Id: Ie9aeca81ba4fb95df0e7e1ee275230378e49b741
"}]
commit_message:
Stop linting zuul-jobs from here

When we run ansible-lint on project-config the tool is finding and
reporting errors in zuul-jobs. Zuul-jobs appears to be included to
ensure that all the roles we use are defined, but we don't want to lint
the content of those roles.

To address this we add ../../zuul to the ansible lint exclude path which
includes zuul-jobs.

Change-Id: Ie9aeca81ba4fb95df0e7e1ee275230378e49b741
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/74/781774/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

This creates the stable/wallaby branch for all client and non-client
libraries
now that we are past the lib freeze on March 11.

If a team wants to wait for a specific patch to make it to the library,
someone from the team can -1 the patch to have it held,or update that

Change-Id: I58a9c1e8e2117931f44f56a377b4e2267a6ee459
'}]
commit_message:
[cyborg] Create for all client and non-client lib wallaby branch

This creates the stable/wallaby branch for all client and non-client
libraries
now that we are past the lib freeze on March 11.

If a team wants to wait for a specific patch to make it to the library,
someone from the team can -1 the patch to have it held,or update that
patch with a different commit SHA.

Patches with no response will be merged by Friday, March 19.

Change-Id: I58a9c1e8e2117931f44f56a377b4e2267a6ee459
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/releases refs/changes/71/780571/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
move flake8 as a pre-commit local target

The goal here is to avoid conflicts between flake8 and hacking version each
2 days.

Inspired from nova's approach [1].

The flake8 version to install will be determined by hacking and
requirements will stay aligned instead of relying on different versions.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/src/branch/master/.pre-commit-config.yaml#L26-L35
[2] https://opendev.org/openstack/hacking/src/branch/master/requirements.txt#L1

Change-Id: Iae20f13ba6293b94b5bd131941263e097eba0518

subject: Support granular allocation candidate list
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-11-27 09:15:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/osc-placement/commit/62190e25a8ab5dcc4245a4192e918166e9aec30a', 'message': 'WIP: Support granular allocation candidate list

This will support something like this:

openstack allocation candidate list \
   --group 1 --resource VCPU=3 \
   --group 2 --resource VCPU=4 \
   --group_policy isolate

WIP: More tests and release note

Change-Id: Ib32181abd12db0c2983065ea9846e911033d53f1
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2019-11-28 07:50:36.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/osc-placement/commit/38b19e78281ef3133108fb5f48697072d025553b', 'message': 'Support granular allocation candidate list

The ``openstack allocation candidate list`` command now supports
``--group`` and ``--group-policy`` option. The ``--group`` option is
accepts integer to group granular requests. If specified, following
given options of resources, required/forbidden traits, and aggregates
are associated to that group and will be satisfied by the same resource
provider in the response. Can be repeated to get candidates from
multiple resource providers in the same resource provider tree.

If multiple groups are supplied, the separate groups may or may not
be satisfied by the same provider. If you want the groups to be
satisfied by different providers, set ``--group_policy`` to
``isolate``.

For example:
    ``openstack allocation candidate list \
        --group 1 --resource VCPU=3 --required HW_CPU_X86_SSE \
        --group 2 --resource VCPU=4 \
        --group_policy isolate``

The granular request is supported in 1.25, but this is tested via
microversion 1.29 since the API is unaware of nested provider
before that version. Note that 1.26-1.29 has no impact to client:
  1.25 - Adds support for granular resource requests via numbered
         querystring groups in GET /allocation_candidates.
  1.26 - Add ability to specify inventory with reserved value equal
         to total.
  1.27 - Include all resource class inventories in `provider_summaries`
         field in response of `GET /allocation_candidates` API even if
         the resource class is not in the requested resources.
  1.28 - Add support for consumer generation
  1.29 - Support nested providers in `GET /allocation_candidates` API.

Change-Id: Ib32181abd12db0c2983065ea9846e911033d53f1

commit_message:
Support granular allocation candidate list

The ``openstack allocation candidate list`` command now supports
``--group`` and ``--group-policy`` option. The ``--group`` option is
accepts integer to group granular requests. If specified, following
given options of resources, required/forbidden traits, and aggregates
are associated to that group and will be satisfied by the same resource
provider in the response. Can be repeated to get candidates from
multiple resource providers in the same resource provider tree.

If multiple groups are supplied, the separate groups may or may not
be satisfied by the same provider. If you want the groups to be
satisfied by different providers, set ``--group_policy`` to
``isolate``.

For example:
    ``openstack allocation candidate list \
        --group 1 --resource VCPU=3 --required HW_CPU_X86_SSE \
        --group 2 --resource VCPU=4 \
        --group_policy isolate``

The granular request is supported in 1.25, but this is tested via
microversion 1.29 since the API is unaware of nested provider
before that version. Note that 1.26-1.29 has no impact to client:
  1.25 - Adds support for granular resource requests via numbered
         querystring groups in GET /allocation_candidates.
  1.26 - Add ability to specify inventory with reserved value equal
         to total.
  1.27 - Include all resource class inventories in `provider_summaries`
         field in response of `GET /allocation_candidates` API even if
         the resource class is not in the requested resources.
  1.28 - Add support for consumer generation
  1.29 - Support nested providers in `GET /allocation_candidates` API.

Change-Id: Ib32181abd12db0c2983065ea9846e911033d53f1

subject: Change downgrade log message to debug.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-12-14 05:46:15.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-cinderclient/commit/3e488ce4d7f8af399335931f7b314a48c3fcb937', 'message': 'Change downgrade log message to debug.

This message that is printed to the user is confusing and is a
warning they cannot do anything about.

My guess is that it is more common to have a client that is newer
than the server and so this message is printed everytime to the user.

Change-Id: Ic97bd74ebd61b0ad65730ab8752a88d4ae283115

commit_message:
Change downgrade log message to debug.

This message that is printed to the user is confusing and is a
warning they cannot do anything about.

My guess is that it is more common to have a client that is newer
than the server and so this message is printed everytime to the user.

Change-Id: Ic97bd74ebd61b0ad65730ab8752a88d4ae283115
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-cinderclient refs/changes/82/766882/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: logger.debug("API version %s requested, " % requested.get_string()) logger.debug("downgrading to %s based on server support." % discovered.get_string())
deleted_lines: logger.warning("API version %s requested, " % requested.get_string()) logger.warning("downgrading to %s based on server support." % discovered.get_string())

subject: Multipath tempest scenarios
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-02-25 22:15:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder-tempest-plugin/commit/a56b2de495865569185ddfc73a492ae27ba61b1d', 'message': 'Multipath tempest scenarios

In order to validate the robustness of the iSCSI multipath code in
OpenStack we require harsher tests than those we have, since they only
test the "happy code path".

This patch adds error injecting tests with validation to confirm there
are no leftovers after an attach or detach failure and an appropriate
explanation in the devref documentation.

We are testing create volume from image and attaching a volume to an
instance under the following networking error scenarios:

 - No errors
 - All paths have 10% incoming packets dropped
 - All paths have 20% incoming packets dropped
 - All paths have 100% incoming packets dropped
 - Half the paths have 20% incoming packets dropped
 - The other half of the paths have 20% incoming packets dropped
 - Half the paths have 100% incoming packets dropped
 - The other half of the paths have 100% incoming packets dropped

There are single execution versions as well as 10 consecutive operations
variants.

Proposed tests are not in line with the tempest mission since they are
not meant to be run in a production environment due to their disruptive
nature while injecting errors.  They need to be run sequentially and
without any other operations running on the deployment.  They also run
sudo commands via local bash or SSH for the verification and error
generation bits.

Recommended configuration in local.conf for single node devstack is:

  [[post-config|$CINDER_CONF]]
  [multipath-backend]
  use_multipath_for_image_xfer=true

  [[post-config|$NOVA_CONF]]
  [libvirt]
  volume_use_multipath = True

  [[post-config|$KEYSTONE_CONF]]
  [token]
  expiration = 14400

  [[test-config|$TEMPEST_CONFIG]]
  [volume-feature-enabled]
  multipath = True
  [volume]
  build_interval = 10
  multipath_type = $MULTIPATH_VOLUME_TYPE
  backend_protocol_tcp_port = 3260
  multipath_backend_addresses = $STORAGE_BACKEND_IP1,$STORAGE_BACKEND_IP2

And the interesting tests can be run from /opt/stack/tempest with:
  $ OS_TEST_TIMEOUT=7200 stestr 'cinder.tests.tempest.scenario.test_multipath.TestMultipath.test_(create_volumes|attach_detach_many)_with_errors_*' --serial -- -f

Change-Id: Id5188e26a6b52f5d00a6dc8ff52a7e1b0c188345

commit_message:
Multipath tempest scenarios

In order to validate the robustness of the iSCSI multipath code in
OpenStack we require harsher tests than those we have, since they only
test the "happy code path".

This patch adds error injecting tests with validation to confirm there
are no leftovers after an attach or detach failure and an appropriate
explanation in the devref documentation.

We are testing create volume from image and attaching a volume to an
instance under the following networking error scenarios:

 - No errors
 - All paths have 10% incoming packets dropped
 - All paths have 20% incoming packets dropped
 - All paths have 100% incoming packets dropped
 - Half the paths have 20% incoming packets dropped
 - The other half of the paths have 20% incoming packets dropped
 - Half the paths have 100% incoming packets dropped
 - The other half of the paths have 100% incoming packets dropped

There are single execution versions as well as 10 consecutive operations
variants.

Proposed tests are not in line with the tempest mission since they are
not meant to be run in a production environment due to their disruptive
nature while injecting errors.  They need to be run sequentially and
without any other operations running on the deployment.  They also run
sudo commands via local bash or SSH for the verification and error
generation bits.

Recommended configuration in local.conf for single node devstack is:

  [[post-config|$CINDER_CONF]]
  [multipath-backend]
  use_multipath_for_image_xfer=true

  [[post-config|$NOVA_CONF]]
  [libvirt]
  volume_use_multipath = True

  [[post-config|$KEYSTONE_CONF]]
  [token]
  expiration = 14400

  [[test-config|$TEMPEST_CONFIG]]
  [volume-feature-enabled]
  multipath = True
  [volume]
  build_interval = 10
  multipath_type = $MULTIPATH_VOLUME_TYPE
  backend_protocol_tcp_port = 3260
  multipath_backend_addresses = $STORAGE_BACKEND_IP1,$STORAGE_BACKEND_IP2

And the interesting tests can be run from /opt/stack/tempest with:
  $ OS_TEST_TIMEOUT=7200 stestr run --serial \
     'cinder_tempest_plugin.scenario.test_multipath.TestMultipath.test_(create_volumes|attach_detach_many)_with_errors_*' -- -f

Change-Id: Id5188e26a6b52f5d00a6dc8ff52a7e1b0c188345

commit_message:
Drop monotonic package from global reqs

Monotonic was only needed for py2 compatibility. Now that projects have
been moved over to time.monotonic, we can drop this req.

Change-Id: I4efb25bc500fa153004609acebfbf55c3b2363a7
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Have pylint job only run on master branch

This is a non-voting job that most people ignore. It is useful as we add
new code to help watch for coding issues, but on stable branches it is
ignored even more. And presumably anything that gets merged to a stable
branch has already been merged to master and had this job run against
it.

To help reduce wasted gate resources, this updates the job to only run
on the master branch. Then when victoria is branched, it will
automatically stop running on stable/victoria.

Ultimately we will want to clean this job out of stable branches. Likely
along with other jobs that we don't need to be running there. But until
we get around to doing that cleanup, this at least makes sure a job is
isn't running if its value is very low.

Change-Id: I8b98cecaef03bbf39dbfd45b1db1e02ec98dc8b8
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Updating time for functional tests

Currenlty, some gates is being failed with logs like this

"""
b'Response: {"description": "Provided object does not match schema
\'Secret\': \'expiration\' is before current time.
Invalid property: \'expiration\'", "title": "Bad Request", "code": 400}'
"""

So it is necessary to update the time to create secrets successfully.

Change-Id: I59707cdf21f6843dbd7db30978e21cff72756e67
(cherry picked from commit af4637bcf2c0cb807fc8392c9e0e5d7d4404d92e)

option with 'in:' keyword, the final result will contain resource
prividers that are associated with ANY of the UUIDs specified in
this occurence of the option, AND are also associated with UUIDs
specified in other occurences.

commit_message:
Support multiple member_of query parameter

The ``openstack allocation candidate list`` and the ``openstack
allocation candidate list`` command now supports ``--member-of``
option, which accepts a list of comma-separated UUIDs of the
resource provider aggregates. If this is specified, the returned
resource providers must be associated with at least one of the
aggregates identified by uuid. This option can be repeated to
add(restrict) the condition with ``--os-placement-api-version 1.24``
or greater.

This deprecates the ``--aggregate-uuid`` option because it is
difficult to keep using this option to support multiple ``member_of``
feature added in microversion 1.24.

Change-Id: I0f3068c411c504380918f27f994734528fe55c77
Co-Autored-By: Tetsuro Nakamura <tetsuro.nakamura.bc@hco.ntt.co.jp>
Story: #2006940
Task: #37613

commit_message:
Bump the openstackdocstheme extension to 1.20

Some options are now automatically configured by the version 1.20:
- project
- html_last_updated_fmt
- latex_engine
- latex_elements
- version
- release.

This will show other versions of the doc, too.

Change-Id: Id8315bc45c8dedce4d7cf76a4078a380f67b8bb0

commit_message:
Delete encryption key after upload-to-image failure

Now upload the encrypted volume to image, if uploading the encrypted volume
to image fails, there is no process to delete the encryption key, the key will
remain. This patch adds process of deleting the key after uploading the encrypted
volume to the image fails.

Closes-bug: #1882019

commit_message:
Reduce number of the workers in fullstack gate job

Fullstack job is using different tox env in the gate
(dsvm-fullstack-gate). To reduce memory usage in that job, some
time ago, in patch [1] we reduced number of test workers from 4
to 3. But it was done for "dsvm-fullstack" tox env, not for
"dsvm-fullstack-gate" thus it had no effect on our CI runs.
Now it is changed also in the CI job's tox env.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/764907

Change-Id: Iec949922be0779a00bf405c2f1d5646c588d323c
Related-Bug: #1906366
(cherry picked from commit d9542b6a0164cbe0c0fd32b15d0d5db652d47a2f)

as first argument.

added_lines: template_name = self.args[0] template = None node_template = self._find_node_template(template_name) if node_template: template = node_template else: relationship_template = self._find_relationship_template(template_name) if relationship_template: template = relationship_template if not template: ExceptionCollector.appendException( KeyError(_( 'Node or relationship template "{0}" was not found.' ).format(template_name))) def _find_relationship_template(self, relationship_template_name): for rel_template in self.tosca_tpl.relationship_templates: if rel_template.name == relationship_template_name: return rel_template

commit_message:
Fix root UUID for streamed partition images

The root UUID changes after a streamed partition image is written to
the block device, causing later deployment failure when assuming the
old UUID.

This change updates the root UUID after streaming the partition image
is complete.

This issue may have been missed in local testing because deploying the
same image repeatedly will result in stable root UUID across runs.

Change-Id: Ice4630c16fc216980488d1427f3b02e1b8a417fa

commit_message:
Reduce number of the workers in fullstack gate job

Fullstack job is using different tox env in the gate
(dsvm-fullstack-gate). To reduce memory usage in that job, some
time ago, in patch [1] we reduced number of test workers from 4
to 3. But it was done for "dsvm-fullstack" tox env, not for
"dsvm-fullstack-gate" thus it had no effect on our CI runs.
Now it is changed also in the CI job's tox env.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/764907

Change-Id: Iec949922be0779a00bf405c2f1d5646c588d323c
Related-Bug: #1906366
(cherry picked from commit d9542b6a0164cbe0c0fd32b15d0d5db652d47a2f)

commit_message:
Add support for allocation candidates in trees

Microversion 1.29 of Placement available since the rocky release changed
what allocation candidates the server might return: it is able to return
allocation candidates organized in trees. Versions before that, remove
any allocation candidates from the response that contain multiple
providers from the same tree.

Change-Id: I88970d70e78e36b5355ff82a4379460869a68929

commit_message:
remove py37

Remove python3.7 from setup.cfg, since Wallaby's python
supported runtimes are python 3.6 and python 3.8[1]:

[1]: https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/wallaby.htm

Change-Id: I4552bea3d42c504da326e990535f798ede028f1f

commit_message:
Upgrade pip version to fix pep-517 enforcing

This upgrade fixes an issue in some disitributions when the build environment
enforces pep-517 and breaks compiling some versions of python libraries.
For example see [1]

[1] https://github.com/sqlalchemy/alembic/issues/707

Story: 2008676
Task: 41973

Change-Id: If3e5d37a42de2fb25c8034d9fdebb16d8bd21e9f
(cherry picked from commit 381aa41d8fe81a11b2276c535bee1f9cfb482780)

subject: [SR-IOV] Do not fail if ip-link vf "min_tx_rate" is not supported
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-03-11 15:47:17.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/cmd/sanity/checks.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/mech_sriov/agent/pci_lib.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/drivers/mech_sriov/agent/test_pci_lib.py', 'neutron/cmd/sanity_check.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/5c45e1e3bf80b54c6db05897cea72e8a4251f4da', 'message': '[SR-IOV] Do not fail if ip-link vf "min_tx_rate" is not supported

Some NICs do not support ip-link vf "min_tx_rate" parameter. This is
not an API issue (ip-link or Pyroute2); the parameter is already
supported. The error is returned by the specific NIC driver.

A sanity check is implemented, reading the SR-IOV configured devices
("physical_device_mappings") and the excluded VFs ("exclude_devices").

Change-Id: If70de0a7112777ac4011ad42af0ac98969765011
Closes-Bug: #1918464

commit_message:
[SR-IOV] Do not fail if ip-link vf "min_tx_rate" is not supported

Some NICs do not support ip-link vf "min_tx_rate" parameter. This is
not an API issue (ip-link or Pyroute2); the parameter is already
supported. The error is returned by the specific NIC driver.

A sanity check is implemented, reading the SR-IOV configured devices
("physical_device_mappings") and the excluded VFs ("exclude_devices").

Change-Id: If70de0a7112777ac4011ad42af0ac98969765011
Closes-Bug: #1918464
(cherry picked from commit 3a9e81bbb8e5a56bd69a1edf1d2922276841157b)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/23/780023/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def check_min_tx_rate_support(): result = checks.min_tx_rate_support() if not result: LOG.warning('There are SR-IOV network interfaces that do not support ' 'setting the minimum TX rate (dataplane enforced minimum ' 'guaranteed bandwidth) "ip-link vf min_tx_rate".') return result BoolOptCallback('check_min_tx_rate_support', check_min_tx_rate_support, help=_('Check if the configured SR-IOV NICs support ' 'the "ip-link vf min_tx_rate" parameter.'), default=False), if cfg.CONF.SRIOV_NIC.physical_device_mappings: cfg.CONF.set_default('check_min_tx_rate_support', True)

commit_message:
Remove linters dependency from content-provider in gate

As part of [1] lets remove the dependency on linters from the
content-provider in the gate, in line with all the other repos.
We don't want to delay the gate for linting since any issues should
be resolved before a change hits the gate. Also removes unused
yaml anchors.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/q/topic:tripleo-ci-reduce

Change-Id: I9d440504c938c57a287282d94108c55f29c443f9

commit_message:
Set ovn_chassis_mac_map in ovn::controller

For distributed vlan in ovn we need to add support of
creating mac addresses per compute and seting them in
external_ids:ovn-chassis-mac-mappings.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/776210
Related-Bug: #1881593
Change-Id: I785400969efba0062aabdca9af2726a7603ef840

added_lines: # [*ovn_chassis_mac_map*] # (optional) A list of key-value pairs that map a chassis specific mac to # a physical network name. commit_message:
Check Ceph cluster healthy state before starting FS to BS playbook

The Ceph OSDs migration from filestore to bluestore should only be
attempted if the cluster is in HEALTH_OK state because during the
process OSDs will be destroyed and recreated.

This change adds a check to poll for the cluster status before the
playbook is triggered.

Change-Id: Ib9c90c4c2e838bed461ac63139b161ab689d28cf
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/777563
Closes-Bug: 1915700
(cherry picked from commit 5250e6d595c7ad97059930809fbeda9b17c1b364)
(cherry picked from commit 1b57684556ae9e61a3088c1cd63db3f0adfb895c)
(cherry picked from commit 36e28d2d364c3215357fd14b2dbc0c53f85b7944)

commit_message:
Add TLS options to oslo.cache

This patch specifies a set of options required to build a TLS context.
The context built from those options can later on be passed to any of
the oslo.cache backends that supports TLS connections.

Train note: Test modifications are not ported to Train, since the
specific test that was modified doesn't exist in Train.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/774120
Change-Id: I835641d402e6cbd6650efd0d7a1fb16fb361350e
(cherry picked from commit 7ae8aa377e393c28af1d8d6b0ba059b984da0725)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-keystone refs/changes/16/775616/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # [*tls_enabled*] # (Optional) Global toggle for TLS usage when comunicating with # the caching servers. # Default to $::os_service_default # # [*tls_cafile*] # (Optional) Path to a file of concatenated CA certificates in PEM # format necessary to establish the caching server's authenticity. # If tls_enabled is False, this option is ignored. # Default to $::os_service_default # # [*tls_certfile*] # (Optional) Path to a single file in PEM format containing the # client's certificate as well as any number of CA certificates # needed to establish the certificate's authenticity. This file # is only required when client side authentication is necessary. # If tls_enabled is False, this option is ignored. # Default to $::os_service_default # # [*tls_keyfile*] # (Optional) Path to a single file containing the client's private # key in. Otherwhise the private key will be taken from the file # specified in tls_certfile. If tls_enabled is False, this option # is ignored. # Default to $::os_service_default # # [*tls_allowed_ciphers*] # (Optional) Set the available ciphers for sockets created with # the TLS context. It should be a string in the OpenSSL cipher # list format. If not specified, all OpenSSL enabled ciphers will # be available. # Default to $::os_service_default # $tls_enabled = $::os_service_default, $tls_cafile = $::os_service_default, $tls_certfile = $::os_service_default, $tls_keyfile = $::os_service_default, $tls_allowed_ciphers = $::os_service_default, tls_enabled => $tls_enabled, tls_cafile => $tls_cafile, tls_certfile => $tls_certfile, tls_keyfile => $tls_keyfile, tls_allowed_ciphers => $tls_allowed_ciphers,

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-03-11 18:28:54.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/52d8b29fa779e6673dbc7d0d3415c571f706e209', 'message': "Stable-CI: Disable ansible testing on ussuri

   checkout v2.2.0.

   and blah, but release team has basically said no to stuff
   like that in the past.
3) Newer ubuntu kernels don't play well with chroot being

deploy interface on this branch.

I view this as low risk because:
1) The underlying CI infrastucture kernel version is what broke the
   build, and we're stuck.

   deploy interface. Essentially the branch is just in maintenance
   and is a target for backports of fixes.
3) We have no other real option, and in the mean time all
   ironic-tempest-plugin patches are blocked and anything
   destined to stable/ussuri is also blocked due to this
   issue. In other words, this is the least evil, most impactful
   path as far as I can see.

commit_message:
Stable-CI: Disable ansible testing on ussuri

There is a chicken/egg problem in CI.

1) Ironic-python-agent-builder is branchless and we can only
   checkout v2.2.0.
2) We might be able to fix that, if we get a branch and tag
   and blah, but release team has basically said no to stuff
   like that in the past.
3) Newer ubuntu kernels don't play well with chroot being
   used with tinyipa. This has been addressed elsewhere,
   but this is functionally a pure chicken/egg sort of
   issue here.
4) Ansible deploy interface requires injection of an ssh key
   so even if we're using pre-built ramdisk images, we can't
   chroot into them nor to fix the branch, also because
   standalone job would still fail as it uses the v2.2.0
   version.

The only clear path I can see is to disable the ansible
deploy interface on this branch.

I view this as low risk because:
1) The underlying CI infrastucture kernel version is what broke the
   build, and we're stuck.
2) We're not actively adding features that would impact the ansible
   deploy interface. Essentially the branch is just in maintenance
   and is a target for backports of fixes.
3) We have no other real option, and in the mean time all
   ironic-tempest-plugin patches are blocked and anything
   destined to stable/ussuri is also blocked due to this
   issue. In other words, this is the least evil, most impactful
   path as far as I can see.

Also:

This patch disables voting on the multinode job on limestone.
The same has been performed on master branch as the CI job seems
to fail on limestone for cross-node connectivity reasons with the
vxlan tunnel.

Change-Id: I36199bbf9b8b003c8c94187e790f39c3bc44f45e

commit_message:
Mark ussuri standalone job non-voting

The ussuri standalone job has been broken for some time
as it attempts to use the ansible deployment interface and
due to a convergence of unluckiness (ci changing, last minute
patch to ironic-python-agent-builder, and an incorrect build
somewhere along the way, this job has become horribly broken
and fails on attempting to inject an ssh key into tinyipa for
the ansible deployment interface to be exercised.

Since this is not critical, the job can be marked non-voting
for now to unblock the tempest plugin's CI.

Change-Id: I5f61d34db7bfb6e3efaccd159310c7c793180bca

commit_message:
[OpenstackSDK] Create for all client and non-client lib wallaby branch

This creates the stable/wallaby branch for all client and non-client libraries
now that we are past the lib freeze on March 11.

If a team wants to wait for a specific patch to make it to the library,
someone from the team can -1 the patch to have it held,or update that
patch with a different commit SHA.

Patches with no response will be merged by Friday, March 19.

Change-Id: I0d9e2637dc5d3dbbb7fd3fd9649de1d7806832be

commit_message:
Increment API version for Secure RBAC

This patch increments the API version for the Secure RBAC
as was covered in the specification in order to signify to
API consumers that may need to be aware if the API surface
can support Secure RBAC policy configuration.

Change-Id: Ia659708bb89ff416b65367505d3e068c6d4a198f

patch with a different commit SHA.

Patches with no response will be merged by Friday, March 19.

Change-Id: I906c016b142e28d741fd6af14eeef9d870ebf283
'}]
commit_message:
[glance] Create for all client and non-client lib wallaby branch

This creates the stable/wallaby branch for all client and non-client libraries
now that we are past the lib freeze on March 11.

If a team wants to wait for a specific patch to make it to the library,
someone from the team can -1 the patch to have it held,or update that
patch with a different commit SHA.

Patches with no response will be merged by Friday, March 19.

Change-Id: I906c016b142e28d741fd6af14eeef9d870ebf283

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/victoria

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/victoria branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I7958561f7cd1b5b5491d80dbc142d83e0388683d

commit_message:
Support configuring cinder's RPC and WSGI timeouts

New CinderRpcResponseTimeout and CinderApiWsgiTimeout parameters
support configuring cinder's corresponding RPC response and WSGI
connection timeouts. The default values (60s each) match the existing
defaults.

Change-Id: I66b472d37041f67907691f55c153ff880093e4bc
(cherry picked from commit 3af965d6d26d3e6a8ddf48a158d930d308a3f70d)

added_lines: CinderApiWsgiTimeout: default: 60 description: The number of seconds until a Cinder API WSGI connection times out. type: number cinder::wsgi::apache::vhost_custom_fragment: str_replace: template: "Timeout TIMEOUT" params: TIMEOUT: {get_param: CinderApiWsgiTimeout}

commit_message:
Refactor BM deployment to use '--work-dir' [1/2]

We added '--output-dir' just a few weeks ago, now it seems
we want to use '--work-dir'. See:
https://review.opendev.org/775302.

Let's re-factor to use the common consistent working directory.

Change-Id: Ic62c599d79383bea18780cc5c25fc5f4843207a2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient refs/changes/68/780968/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # TODO(hjensas): Remove 'output-dir' use common 'workdir' instead. # See: https://review.opendev.org/775302 parser.add_argument( '--working-dir', action='store', help=_('The working directory for the deployment where all ' 'input, output, and generated files will be stored.\n' 'Defaults to "$HOME/overcloud-deploy-<stack>"') ) if not parsed_args.working_dir: self.working_dir = os.path.join( os.path.expanduser('~'), "overcloud-deploy-%s" % parsed_args.stack) else: self.working_dir = os.path.abspath(parsed_args.working_dir) utils.makedirs(self.working_dir) "output_dir": output_dir, "working_dir": self.working_dir

commit_message:
Add image member update command

Set the status of the target member for the image.

Change-Id: Ic88889b2a72d1472f0af241ce731333c5b1420f3
Closes-Bug: #1620481
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient refs/changes/24/367224/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class ImageSetProject(command.ShowOne): """Set the status of the target project for the image.""" def get_parser(self, prog_name): parser = super(ImageSetProject, self).get_parser(prog_name) parser.add_argument( "image", metavar="<image>", help=_("Image to set (name or ID)"), ) parser.add_argument( "project", metavar="<project>", help=_("Project to set with image (name or ID)"), ) parser.add_argument( "status", metavar="<status>", choices=['accepted', 'rejected', 'pending'], help=_('Set project status ("accepted", "rejected", ' '"pending")'), ) common.add_project_domain_option_to_parser(parser) return parser def take_action(self, parsed_args): image_client = self.app.client_manager.image identity_client = self.app.client_manager.identity project_id = common.find_project(identity_client, parsed_args.project, parsed_args.project_domain).id image_id = utils.find_resource( image_client.images, parsed_args.image).id image_member = image_client.image_members.update( image_id, project_id, parsed_args.status ) return zip(*sorted(six.iteritems(image_member)))

commit_message:
Fix molecule jobs after release of cryptography3.4

Molecule jobs[0] fails with below error:-

ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'setuptools_rust'

This error appeared following the release of cryptography 3.4, which
now includes Rust code. It can be installed without Rust using a
Python wheel, but only with more recent pip than version 9.0.3
available as RPM on CentOS 8.

The cryptography bug report [1] recommends pip>=19.1.1.

[0] https://e99635be2c7386b5beda-3dea60a35fb0d38e41c535f13b48e895.ssl.cf1.rackcdn.com/773531/1/gate/tripleo-ansible-centos-8-molecule-tripleo_network_config/b1284cd/job-output.txt
[1] https://github.com/pyca/cryptography/issues/5753
Related-Bug: #1915101

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-validations/+/774814
Change-Id: Ib5baad39dd7e43dff9046178c00b0f836dc18bae

commit_message:
Remove Deprecated Ceph Environment Files

hyperconverged-ceph.yaml has been deprecated since Nov 2017.
storage-environment.yaml has been deprecated since Jan 2018.
storage-environment-external.yaml has been deprecated since
Jan 2018. tuned-ceph-filestore-hci.yaml is only for Filestore,
though Bluestore has been the default for multiple Ceph releases.
update-from-ceph-newton.yaml is not needed for Wallaby.

Change-Id: Icb0d1fe6c3e67d99a5152b62572d7d2a2798a124

commit_message:
Remove ovn_dbs puppet_config section

There are no config files generated whatsoever. The folder is created
and empty and since it has no manifests there is little point in running it at all.
Let's just remove it.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ansible/+/776589
Change-Id: I5e1519c8f441213b264008fda62a1a442cf9d243
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/91/776591/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: # BEGIN DOCKER SETTINGS puppet_config: config_volume: 'ovn_dbs' puppet_tags: 'exec' step_config: '' config_image: &ovn_dbs_config_image {get_param: ContainerOvnDbsConfigImage}

commit_message:
Add legacy fact setting

When we disable inject facts by default, there were some additional
roles that we missed (ipaclient).  We can just set the legacy facts to
prevent issues with missing distribution var updates.

Change-Id: Ib488a6573c035fc8288a4b24461af56d40416c5d
Related-Bug: #1919064
(cherry picked from commit d8408ebb86efdda0055ae41c6db350c14772dc6a)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/94/780894/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: tasks: - name: Set legacy facts set_fact: ansible_distribution: "{{ ansible_facts['distribution'] }}" ansible_distribution_major_version: "{{ ansible_facts['distribution_major_version'] }}" ansible_distribution_release: "{{ ansible_facts['distribution_release'] }}" ansible_distribution_version: "{{ ansible_facts['distribution_version'] }}" ansible_os_family: "{{ ansible_facts['os_family'] }}"

Change-Id: I3e727756fdfd26b58796815396b2b7a5a491e39b
Closes-Bug: #1606221

commit_message:
Add command to list security groups of a server

Adding command "openstack server security group list"
to list security groups of a server. Similar to command
"nova list-secgroup".

Change-Id: I3e727756fdfd26b58796815396b2b7a5a491e39b
Closes-Bug: #1606221
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient refs/changes/79/390379/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class ListServerSecurityGroup(command.Lister): """List security groups of server""" def get_parser(self, prog_name): parser = super(ListServerSecurityGroup, self).get_parser(prog_name) parser.add_argument( 'server', metavar='<server>', help=_('Server (name or ID)'), ) return parser def take_action(self, parsed_args): compute_client = self.app.client_manager.compute server = utils.find_resource( compute_client.servers, parsed_args.server, ) data = server.list_security_group() columns = ( "ID", "Name", "Description", ) return (columns, (utils.get_item_properties( s, columns, ) for s in data))

commit_message:
To include 'Project' column for 'port list --long' command

Include a column 'Project' that displays the tenant_id,
when port details are viewed with --long option

Change-Id: I55fad2b71d8a02db6dbf7624b3398e4765a08491
Closes-Bug: #1648001
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient refs/changes/22/408322/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix the output of quota show

This patch fixes the improper output of "quota show" command,
'project_name' and 'project_id' will show right information.

Change-Id: I33d455c7203659da0ad39da43760d81b32c1c8c0
Closes-Bug: #1663151

commit_message:
enable glance client to support client cert

This patch solved problems that fail when glance endpoint is HTTPS.
fail operations are below
 * openstack server create
 * openstack image show

Change-Id: Id111275c012bbdd8c4d7070a05e4a8999e34abd7
Related-Bug: #1712282
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient refs/changes/78/496178/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
List images with --tags for 'openstack image list'

Now user can list images with --tags options using
command 'openstack image list'.

Change-Id: I96ea9a684ed634ecedfc8f06101bc297d541ec1f
Closes-Bug: #1702066
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient refs/changes/15/481615/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: parser.add_argument( "--tags", metavar="<tags>", help=_("List images according to their tags."), ) elif parsed_args.tags: columns = ("ID", "Name", "Status", "tags") column_headers = ("ID", "Name", "Status", "Tags") if parsed_args.tags: data = [i for i in data if parsed_args.tags in i['tags']]

commit_message:
Add support for Cinder API 3.3/3.5 into OSC

This patch implements the neccessary commands to utilize the
Messages API introduced in Cinder API version 3.3. Version 3.5
only implemented pagination support for these commands which is
present in this patch as well.

volume message get <ID>
volume message list
volume message delete <ID>

Change-Id: I13e69a2ac4d80baf464001c0162939fe7ab4a2b5

commit_message:
Fixes the issue that instance bond port can't get IP address

The issue is that when a port group doesn't have a mac address assigned by
operators, and during provisioning we unbind/bind tenant port with None which
causes the mac address to be regenerated twice and differs from the originally
one allocated by nova or users which was packed into config drive. The end result
is that, bond port has different mac address configured and can't the IP address
from neutron.

Story: 2008300
Task: 41185
(cherry picked from commit fe01ddb2bce12dc1693d64a30e5b1b822e7b839e)

Conflicts:
	ironic/common/neutron.py
	ironic/drivers/modules/network/common.py

Change-Id: I92ed5d17239216324d6a69e0ed8771fd6948d6ec
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/81/762681/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

address='ff:54:00:cf:2d:32', internal_info={'tenant_vif_port_id': uuidutils.generate_uuid()}) with task_manager.acquire(self.context, self.node.id) as task: self.interface.unconfigure_tenant_networks(task) mock_unbind_port.assert_has_calls([ mock.call(self.port.extra['vif_port_id'], context=task.context, reset_mac=True), mock.call(pg.internal_info['tenant_vif_port_id'], context=task.context, reset_mac=True)]) @mock.patch.object(neutron_common, 'unbind_neutron_port', autospec=True) def uuidutils.generate_uuid()}) with task_manager.acquire(self.context, self.node.id) as task: self.interface.unconfigure_tenant_networks(task) mock_unbind_port.assert_has_calls([ mock.call(self.port.extra['vif_port_id'], context=task.context, reset_mac=True), mock.call(pg.internal_info['tenant_vif_port_id'], context=task.context, reset_mac=False)]) @mock.patch.object(neutron_common, 'wait_for_host_agent', autospec=True) @mock.patch.object(neutron_common, 'update_neutron_port', autospec=True) @mock.patch.object(neutron_common, 'get_client', autospec=True) @mock.patch.object(neutron_common, 'get_local_group_information', autospec=True) def test_configure_tenant_networks_with_portgroups_no_address( self, glgi_mock, client_mock, update_mock, wait_agent_mock): pg = utils.create_test_portgroup( self.context, node_id=self.node.id, address=None, extra={'vif_port_id': uuidutils.generate_uuid()}) port1 = utils.create_test_port( self.context, node_id=self.node.id, address='ff:54:00:cf:2d:33', uuid=uuidutils.generate_uuid(), portgroup_id=pg.id, local_link_connection={'switch_id': '0a:1b:2c:3d:4e:ff', 'port_id': 'Ethernet1/1', 'switch_info': 'switch2'} ) port2 = utils.create_test_port( self.context, node_id=self.node.id, address='ff:54:00:cf:2d:34', uuid=uuidutils.generate_uuid(), portgroup_id=pg.id, local_link_connection={'switch_id': '0a:1b:2c:3d:4e:ff', 'port_id': 'Ethernet1/2', 'switch_info': 'switch2'} ) local_group_info = {'a': 'b'} glgi_mock.return_value = local_group_info expected_body = { 'port': { 'binding:vnic_type': 'baremetal', 'binding:host_id': self.node.uuid, } } call1_body = copy.deepcopy(expected_body) call1_body['port']['binding:profile'] = { 'local_link_information': [self.port.local_link_connection] } call1_body['port']['mac_address'] = '52:54:00:cf:2d:32' call2_body = copy.deepcopy(expected_body) call2_body['port']['binding:profile'] = { 'local_link_information': [port1.local_link_connection, port2.local_link_connection], 'local_group_information': local_group_info } with task_manager.acquire(self.context, self.node.id) as task: # Override task.portgroups here, to have ability to check # that mocked get_local_group_information was called with # this portgroup object. task.portgroups = [pg] self.interface.configure_tenant_networks(task) client_mock.assert_called_once_with(context=task.context) glgi_mock.assert_called_once_with(task, pg) update_mock.assert_has_calls( [mock.call(self.context, self.port.extra['vif_port_id'], call1_body), mock.call(self.context, pg.extra['vif_port_id'], call2_body)] )

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/94/780994/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: * `OpenStack Installation Guides for Victoria <https://docs.openstack.org/victoria/install/>`_Minimal deployment for Victoria ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ At a minimum, you need to install the following services. Install the services in the order specified below: * Identity service – `keystone installation for Victoria <https://docs.openstack.org/keystone/victoria/install/>`_ * Image service – `glance installation for Victoria <https://docs.openstack.org/glance/victoria/install/>`_ * Placement service – `placement installation for Victoria <https://docs.openstack.org/placement/victoria/install/>`_ * Compute service – `nova installation for Victoria <https://docs.openstack.org/nova/victoria/install/>`_ * Networking service – `neutron installation for Victoria <https://docs.openstack.org/neutron/victoria/install/>`_ We advise to also install the following components after you have installed the minimal deployment services: * Dashboard – `horizon installation for Victoria <https://docs.openstack.org/horizon/victoria/install/>`_ * Block Storage service – `cinder installation for Victoria <https://docs.openstack.org/cinder/victoria/install/>`_

Add unit test for diskfile.relink_paths

Add unit tests for diskfile.relink_paths to cover the new
object dir existing but not being a dir.

Change-Id: I5fbf8671f2ee63467d46f651e2c24529a2697626
Related-Change: Ia041f7b7dbd4e264072325b4b52718fef9966708

added_lines: def test_relink_paths_object_dir_exists_but_not_dir(self): target_dir = os.path.join(self.testdir, 'd1') os.mkdir(target_dir) target_path = os.path.join(target_dir, 't1.data') with open(target_path, 'w') as fd: fd.write(target_path) # make a file where the new object dir should be new_target_dir = os.path.join(self.testdir, 'd2') with open(new_target_dir, 'w') as fd: fd.write(new_target_dir) new_target_path = os.path.join(new_target_dir, 't1.data') with self.assertRaises(OSError) as cm: diskfile.relink_paths(target_path, new_target_path) self.assertEqual(errno.ENOTDIR, cm.exception.errno) # make a symlink to target where the new object dir should be os.unlink(new_target_dir) os.symlink(target_path, new_target_dir) with self.assertRaises(OSError) as cm: diskfile.relink_paths(target_path, new_target_path) self.assertEqual(errno.ENOTDIR, cm.exception.errno)

subject: Fix `_data_table.html` weird conditional.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-03-16 11:48:22.000000000', 'files': ['horizon/templates/horizon/common/_data_table.html'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/3e4d0ad77e45212276efa6778acb03bdaeecbffb', 'message': 'Fix `_data_table.html` weird conditional.

While troubleshooting a problem with pagination I noticed the
following conditional in `horizon/templates/horizon/common/_data_table.html`:

```
      {% if table.number_of_pages is defined %}
        {% include "horizon/common/_data_table_pagination.html" %}
      {% else %}
        {% include "horizon/common/_data_table_pagination_with_pages.html" %}
      {% endif %}
```

At first sight, it looks wrong. I mean, if there are
number_of_pages, we should use `_data_table_pagination_with_pages.html`.
However, this conditional solves to `True` if
table.number_of_pages is NOT defined, and then it solves to `False`,
if it is defined. It is a very weird (to me) behavior.

Therefore, I am suggesting to use a more readable and understandable
conditional in this patch.

We can simply use `if table.number_of_pages is None`, which will
behave as expected; if there are not number of pages, we use the
traditional paging, and then, if there are number of pages, we use
the paged data table approach.

Change-Id: I933b1f9399f40569c7661c1db5776d468917b966
'}]
commit_message:
Fix `_data_table.html` weird conditional.

While troubleshooting a problem with pagination I noticed the
following conditional in `horizon/templates/horizon/common/_data_table.html`:

```
      {% if table.number_of_pages is defined %}
        {% include "horizon/common/_data_table_pagination.html" %}
      {% else %}
        {% include "horizon/common/_data_table_pagination_with_pages.html" %}
      {% endif %}
```

At first sight, it looks wrong. I mean, if there are
number_of_pages, we should use `_data_table_pagination_with_pages.html`.
However, this conditional solves to `True` if
table.number_of_pages is NOT defined, and then it solves to `False`,
if it is defined. It is a very weird (to me) behavior.

Therefore, I am suggesting to use a more readable and understandable
conditional in this patch.

We can simply use `if table.number_of_pages is None`, which will
behave as expected; if there are not number of pages, we use the
traditional paging, and then, if there are number of pages, we use
the paged data table approach.

Change-Id: I933b1f9399f40569c7661c1db5776d468917b966
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/98/780798/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: {% if table.number_of_pages is None %} {% if table.number_of_pages is None %}
deleted_lines: {% if table.number_of_pages is defined %} {% if table.number_of_pages is defined %}

commit_message:
Add runtime gpu capabilities to ilo inspection

Add gpu related dynamic capabilities in ilo inspection.
It would add following dynamic capabilities:

gpu_<vendor>_count : Integer
gpu_<gpu_device_name>_count : Integer
gpu_<gpu_device_name> : boolean

story: 2008702
task: 42023

Change-Id: Ic785fbe8a40d8a999e7e319a6505b46f82ba8344
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/38/779538/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Add the capabilities starting with "gpu_" to the supported capabilities # keys set as they are runtime generated keys and cannot be hardcoded. for k in capabilities: if k.startswith("gpu_"): CAPABILITIES_KEYS.update({k})

commit_message:
[SVF]: Volume name is not validated for host

[Spectrum Virtualize Family] During terminate_connection
volume_name is passed as input to ensure that volume
mapping for the host is removed.

Currently get_host_by_connector ignore the volume_name validation
if the host is found in the connector wwpns. This causes issues in
some scenarios where WWPNS from different host entry are passed.

Closes-Bug: #1892034

Change-Id: I55f7dd92a4a1bab4a6b00d1b42707aa98b4b2eae
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/34/753134/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if volume_name: hosts_map_info = self.ssh.lsvdiskhostmap(volume_name) hosts_map_info_list = list(hosts_map_info.select('host_name')) if host_name and host_name in hosts_map_info_list: LOG.info("get_host_from_connector: hosts_map_info:" " %s", hosts_map_info_list) LOG.info('Leave: get_host_from_connector: host %s.', host_name) return host_name elif host_name: LOG.info('get_host_from_connector: host %s not mapped ' 'to volume', host_name) host_name = None

commit_message:
Use TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE

UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is old name and deprecated
This allows to use upper-constraints file as more
readable way instead of UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE=<lower-constraints file>.

Change-Id: I0c8c2c4a783c4f0ac9f7530d4d18937ce5b17c61

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-03-10 23:27:50.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/3d7e2f8e8a50ae7ff2ab2c74a25e49106f9c3a8b', 'message': 'WIP: Fix invalid JSON generated by quota details

the api layer serialises to JSON as a string.

Note that if a resource has no reservations then its value will be
defaulted in DbQuotaDriver.get_detailed_tenant_quotas to the integer

'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2021-03-12 12:32:50.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/ce4364a390249e16f1775bb0b5e5ed071c8432cb', 'message': "Fix invalid JSON generated by quota details
